summary: Year 1852  was a leap year starting on Thursday of the Gregorian calendar.
full_text: Augustus Welby Northmore Pugin  was an English architect, designer, artist and critic, chiefly remembered for his pioneering role in the Gothic Revival style; his work culminated in the interior design of the Palace of Westminster. Pugin designed many churches in England, and some in Ireland and Australia. Pugin was the son of Auguste Pugin, and the father of E.W. and Peter Paul Pugin, who continued his architectural firm as Pugin & Pugin.
title: Augustus Pugin
